Len's Island introduces players to an open-world survival crafting experience with dungeon crawling elements. The launch reveals a vibrant setting where players can build, farm, and explore alone or with friends. The environment features bright blue waters, rocky cliffs, and customizable rafts navigating between islands, highlighting the game's focus on exploration and player-driven adventure.

Gameplay and Visuals

Players begin their journey with limited tools, inviting creative problem-solving and resource management. The setting
title: Len’s Island 1.0 Launch Showcases Survival and Dungeon Crawling

Holy Shoot is a first-person action roguelike shooter developed by Tale Era Interactive, bringing players into a stylized battle against demonic forces. The latest demo highlights intense combat, procedurally generated environments, and encounters with formidable bosses.

Gameplay and Visuals

Players take on the role of sanctified warriors equipped with unique abilities and powerful upgrades. The game showcases a vibrant, stylized art direction, with rocky terrains and imposing demonic figures, including a prominent red, horned boss cha
title: Holy Shoot Demo Reveals Stylized Roguelike Action and Bosses

author: Editorial Team
description:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/LPo-XbC3YB4

 

Rail Route, developed by Bitrich.info, brings rail network management to a wider audience with its launch on Nintendo Switch. Players can establish and automate sprawling rail networks across a range of real-world inspired maps, offering both accessible entry and deep strategic gameplay.

Gameplay and Visuals

Players start with basic tracks and stations, gradually expanding their railway empire as they unlock automation tools such as sensors and automatic routers. The interface features minimalist, clean visuals with clearly defined train lines and s
title: Rail Route Launches on Nintendo Switch with Rail Network Management

Pirates Outlaws 2: Heritage brings a fresh chapter to the deckbuilding roguelike genre, introducing new mechanics and a vibrant pirate world. Developed by Fabled Game, the upcoming title is set to launch on PC and Mac in 2025, offering players expanded customization and strategic depth.

Gameplay and Visuals

Pirates Outlaws 2: Heritage features animated pirate characters and colorful environments, including a coastal town and ship. Players will collect and fuse cards to build powerful decks, with the ability to customize strategies using
title: Pirates Outlaws 2: Heritage Showcases New Deckbuilding Features

author: Victor Tan
description: Wielding multiple elements and fighting your way to be a master is a difficult task. There will be many times where you stumble on your way. But with grit and persistence, you overcome the obstacles to become a master. Then push yourself even further to see what heights you can
title: Wizard of Legend 2 Review: Typical Elemental Roguelike

author: Matthew Bowen
description: After a long wait, the Nintendo Switch 2 has hit the scene - and people are loving it. Boasting much stronger hardware that brings it up to current-gen standards, third party support is about to look much better. As it should, as the final years of the Switch life saw a myriad of sub-par ports, struggling to run on the dated horsepower of the Switch. Triple-A blockbusters and even some AA and indie titles suffered
title: 10 Games That Need a Switch 2 Upgrade

The Blood of Dawnwalker delivers a dark fantasy action-adventure RPG experience set in a richly detailed 14th-century European world. Players step into the role of Coen, a half-human, half-vampire navigating a land ravaged by conflict and the Black Death, where supernatural forces battle for power and survival.

Gameplay and Visuals

The game features visceral, third-person action-oriented combat with a variety of weapons, supernatural abilities, and dynamic movement options. Players can wield swords, unleash v
title: The Blood of Dawnwalker Gameplay Deep Dive and Features

The Blood of Dawnwalker introduces players to a dark fantasy action-adventure RPG set in 14th-century Europe, blending supernatural combat, narrative choices, and a richly detailed world. Developed by Rebel Wolves, the game centers on Coen—half-human, half-vampire—navigating a world torn by conflict and the Black Death.

Gameplay and Visuals

The gameplay is third-person and action-oriented, offering a mix of swordplay, supernatural abilities, and magic. Players can switch between human and vampiric powers, utilizing a suite of weapons and skills to tackle
title: The Blood of Dawnwalker Gameplay Deep Dive and Features

Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds expands its roster by introducing SpongeBob SquarePants and Patrick Star as playable characters. Players can now race through a Bikini Bottom-themed course and take the iconic Patty Wagon for a spin, adding a unique crossover experience to the high-speed action.

Main Characters and Setting

The game features SpongeBob SquarePants and Patrick Star, instantly recognizable cartoon characters. Racers can compete on a vibrant Bikini Bottom track, highlighted by the Krusty Krab and ocean
title: Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds Adds SpongeBob and Bikini Bottom
